Event.name: Procreative_sex
Event.definition: <def-root>This frame exists to define a type of Sex where the intended result is procreation.</def-root>

Arg.name: Participants
Arg.definition: <def-root>The set of entities engaged in or subjected to procreative sexual contact.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the length of time that an entire sexual encounter can last, including but not necessarily implying the length of all stages of the encounter.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>A description of the sex act which is not covered by more specific FEs. In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of one or more <fen>Participants</fen> that also affect the action.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which <fen>Participants</fen> accomplish a sexual act.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>To be clear: the place FE describes the overall location of the <fen>Participants</fen> of the sexual activity and nothing else.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE relates the relative time of occurrence of the sexual activity.</def-root>

Arg.name: Domain
Arg.definition: <def-root>For a sexual act, the <fen>Domain</fen> describes the specific realm of the contact between <fen>Participants</fen>; for example, phone sex.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the justification of a sexual act, for at least one of the <fen>Participants</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: make baby.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: This LU conveys specific intent by at least one participant in Procreative_sex to successfully procreate.
